title: Match History Not Functioning Properly
body:
edit: [SOLVED]

Whenever I try to get to my match history on the LoL website, all that comes up is a white screen with no games or anything. I've tried with safari chrome i.e and firefox, none of them work. I use a Mac, El Capitan operating system. It worked in the past when I was using El Capitan, so I'm not sure what's going on. Any help would be great.

Screenshot: https://gyazo.com/a172f832d537a7613c40150130c7df33

replies.body:
This issue seems to have cropped up again, after having been fixed for awhile.

Not sure if what broke is the same, but match history is no longer viewable, at least for me.  I just get the empty box on both Firefox and Explorer.  (I'm sorry, I'm not the web pro that some of the people who posted in this thread are, so I can't really track it down.) Clearing cache didn't help.

This has been a problem on and off. My [Chrome extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/league-of-legends-match-h/mdgeabipdapmbcpdldplafegigjhpain?hl=en) may fix your issue. [Original post](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4670249&page=18#post50208069).

Some folks are experiencing a 403 issue with AWS, in which case this extension won't fix the issue.

> [{quoted}](name=distilledchaos,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=MffEPIuO,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-01-14T01:24:31.641+0000)
>
> This has been a problem on and off. My [Chrome extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/league-of-legends-match-h/mdgeabipdapmbcpdldplafegigjhpain?hl=en) may fix your issue. [Original post](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4670249&page=18#post50208069).
> 
> Some folks are experiencing a 403 issue with AWS, in which case this extension won't fix the issue.

This fixed it. Thanks!

I was able to load up[ your match history](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-history/NA1/228111846) just fine without any issues.  There could be an OS setting or cache that's causing this issue.  Since you've already tried a few browsers, hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can look into your issue.  We'll reply back as soon as possible!

Hi, webdeveloper here, I have tracked it down myself to a truncated Twig.js file. I think maybe you guys got a bad push somewhere or something corrupted on a cdn. It seems you load theses assets off of S3, so maybe check your buckets.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/assets/1.0.19/lib/twig.js

that's the link to the truncated JS in question.

Here is the remote IP that it's being resolved to: 104.16.139.241

Please fix. Let me know if you need more info.

It doesn't look to be a cache issue at all.

When i click the link to his match history i get the same issue he posted, same with my own match history across multiple different browsers (chrome, firefox, DefinitlyNotExploerer) and operating systems (windows 10, GNOME, KDE).

When I pull his up I get a couple errors (caching off in browser entirely):

>Uncaught ReferenceError: Twig is not defined

which is likely caused by

>Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected end of input

in twig.js on line 3625.

It looks to me that it is returning an incomplete JS file as it ends with 

>            case '/':
                b = p

At minimum, there should be a final

> }

there, but my guess is that there is a lot more missing. Maybe it's a CDN issue if this has already been fixed?

HTTP response headers (edit: for twig.js):

> HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Fri, 30 Dec 2016 23:00:22 GMT
Content-Type: application/javascript
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Connection: keep-alive
Cache-Control: public, max-age=14400
Content-Encoding: gzip
Last-Modified: Thu, 08 Dec 2016 20:02:45 GMT
x-amz-id-2: mIYBxooIao3lv8E+D514++A9koi/pJWc3lRD0bDL4F5NRc3KuhLQASGu+R8xp+WSh5c88v88HtI=
x-amz-request-id: C3275CD695270397
X-HOST: matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com
X-RK-PATH: /assets/1.0.19/lib/twig.js
CF-Cache-Status: HIT
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Expires: Sat, 31 Dec 2016 03:00:22 GMT
Server: cloudflare-nginx
CF-RAY: 31991b8677c909c4-ORD

Doesn't work for me either.

Tried on multiple computers and browsers. I had assumed it was just down! OP let me know if you manage to fix. Thanks!
Try to do a "refresh + cache clear" in your browser. On windows, that is typically Ctrl+F5 or Ctrl+Shift+R.
